mdRecord.dcterms:title: The tourist's pocket map of the state of Georgia: exhibiting its internal improvements, roads, distances, &c
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Mitchell, S. Augustus (Samuel Augustus), 1792-1868
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Tables of steam boat routes: Savannah to Augusta -- Savannah to Charleston, S.C. -- Columbus to Appalachicola, Fl. Ter. -- Savannah to Picolata, Fl. Ter.
Explanation to the left of the imprint codes for County towns, stage roads, canals and rail roads. A second explanation to the right of the imprint explains the distance figures.
"Entered according to Act of Congress in the year 1834 by S. Augustus Mitchell in the Clerks office, of the eastern District of Pennsylvania."
Possibly the same as the J.H. Young map, removed from the covers. Neither Young's name nor the 1830 Georgia census figures appear on the map.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Georgia--Maps, Tourist
Georgia--Maps
